intro: Cyphostemma dysocarpum subsp. glandulosissimum, commonly known as the glandular cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its vine-like growth habit. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves and produces yellowish flowers that develop into elongated, fleshy fruits. Its subspecies is distinguished by the presence of glandular structures on its stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique botanical identity.
